intro: Teclea gossweileri, commonly known as the Ethiopian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in cool and moist conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem, while its roots are fibrous and adapted to nutrient-poor soils. Teclea gossweileri is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
